Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PMAP-37(F34-R) (PMAP-37 F34R, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1; Derivative: Chol-37(F34-R))
Sequence Information.Source: Amino acid substitution, cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature.Author: Zhou J, Chen L, Liu Y, Shen T, Zhang C, Liu Z, Feng X, Wang C. 2019
Literature.Title: Antimicrobial peptide PMAP-37 analogs: Increasing the positive charge to enhance the antibacterial activity of PMAP-37.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (97.3%) toparent 	PMAP-37Activity: Active against Gram+ S. aureusATCC25923 (MIC 0.025 ug/ml), S. epidermidis LY8 (MIC 25 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes CICC21533 (MIC 31.25 ug/ml), B. subtilis CICC24434 (MIC 0.78 ug/ml), Gram- S. choleraesuis C78-1 (MIC 0.78 ug/ml), S. typhimurium SL1344 (MIC 0.78 ug/ml), P. avium C48-3 (MIC 1.56 ug/ml), and E. coli CICC10004 (MIC 6.25 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: pH-sensitive especially above pH 12; activity reduced with boiling time to 120 min.Recombinant production:yeast:Pichia pastoris: this variant has been expressed and further characterized.Animal model:mouse: more animal survived with the peptide treatment for 3 days.Peptide conjugate: coupling cholesterol at the N-terminus of the peptide increased peptide activity, stability and in vivo efficacy (Chen et al., 2020).
